Ingredients:

  • 1 pound pork belly or pork shoulder, thinly sliced
  • 2 tablespoons cooking oil
  • 4 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 onion, chopped
  • 2 tablespoons shrimp paste (bagoong alamang)
  • 4-6 Thai chili peppers, sliced (adjust according to your spice tolerance)
  • 1 cup coconut milk
  • 1 cup coconut cream
  • 1 tablespoon soy sauce
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Heat the cooking oil in a large pan or wok over medium heat.

  2. Add the minced garlic and saut√© until fragrant and lightly golden.

  3. Add the chopped onion and cook until translucent.

  4. Add the sliced pork and cook until browned on all sides.

  5. Stir in the shrimp paste and Thai chili peppers. Cook for a minute to incorporate the flavors.

  6. Pour in the coconut milk and coconut cream. Stir well to combine.

  7. Bring the mixture to a simmer and let it cook for about 15-20 minutes, or until the pork is tender and the sauce has thickened slightly.

  8. Stir in the soy sauce and season with salt and pepper to taste. Adjust the spiciness by adding more Thai chili peppers if desired.

  9. Continue simmering for another few minutes to let the flavors meld together.

  10. Remove from heat and transfer the Bicol Express to a serving dish.

  11. Serve hot with steamed rice.

Note: Bicol Express is known for its fiery spiciness. However, you can adjust the amount of chili peppers according to your preference for heat. Additionally, feel free to add vegetables like green beans or bell peppers for added flavor and color.

Enjoy your spicy and flavorful Bicol Express!
